Name: Ericka (Erick David) Yáñez
Description: Shot and killed, allegedly by a police officer

Name: Nireah Johnson
Description:
Nireah and her friend Brandie Coleman were murdered by Paul Moore after Moore discovered that Nireah was transgender. He then set their vehicle on fire.

Moore was convicted on two counts of murder, criminal confinement and arson and sentenced to a total of 120 years in prison. Moore's half brother, Clarence McGee, 26, was convicted of arson, assisting a criminal and obstruction of justice and sentenced to 10 years

> Remember #NireahJohnson & #BrandiColeman

Name: Brandie Coleman
Description:
Brandie (who was a cisgender woman) and her friend Nireah Johnson were murdered by Paul Moore after Moore discovered that Nireah was transgender. He then set their vehicle on fire.

Moore was convicted on two counts of murder, criminal confinement and arson and sentenced to a total of 120 years in prison. Moore's half brother, Clarence McGee, 26, was convicted of arson, assisting a criminal and obstruction of justice and sentenced to 10 years

Name: Selena Alvarez-Hernández
Description:
Selena was stabbed multiple times in the chest, abdomen, and arms outside of an apartment complex. In 2014 James Cain Harris, 36, was convicted of first degree murder.

Harris had repeatedly stabbed Selena while robbing her.

> In the early morning hours on July 31, 2003, [deadname] Selena” Alvarez-Hernandez, 33, was stabbed to death in front of an apartment building located at 1613 So. 13th St. in Council Bluffs, Iowa.
>
> Officers were dispatched at 1:59 a.m. to Apartment #1 regarding a disturbance, and reported that upon arrival they located a Hispanic [female] lying on the ground in front of the apartment building. [She] had been stabbed eight times.
>
> The victim — who carried several ID cards and whose identity was not immediately known — was transported by ambulance to Creighton Medical Center in Omaha, Neb., where [she] died from [her] injuries.
